Join a top team at a fast growing company that is working towards real social impact. Make an account and try us out at our website and connect with our passionate community on our Wall of Love.

The Role

As a Staff Software Engineer for Agents Infrastructure, you'll architect and build the core systems that power MagicSchool's autonomous AI capabilities. You'll design the runtime, orchestration, and evaluation infrastructure that enables AI agents to plan, execute complex educational workflows, integrate with teaching tools, and operate safely in classroom environments.

This is a high-impact IC role where you'll influence the technical foundation of how AI agents operate across MagicSchool's platform, mentor engineers on agent systems, and ensure our agentic capabilities scale reliably for millions of educators.

What You'll Do

  • Agent Runtime Architecture – Design and implement highly reliable agent orchestration systems, shared state management, memory systems, and multi-step workflow execution optimized for educational use cases.

  • Tool Integration & Safety – Build secure, sandboxed execution environments for agent actions with robust isolation, monitoring, and safety controls appropriate for educational contexts.

  • Evaluation & Reliability – Develop comprehensive evaluation frameworks for agent performance, safety assessments, A/B testing, and regression detection to ensure consistent quality in educational workflows.

  • Platform Integration – Create unified interfaces for multiple LLM providers, integrate with educational tool ecosystems, and build connector frameworks for curriculum data and learning management systems.

  • Cross-Functional Leadership – Partner with Product, Research, and Education teams to translate complex educational workflows into reliable agent capabilities from prototype to production.

  • Technical Mentorship – Guide engineers on agent architecture patterns, evaluation methodologies, and best practices for building reliable autonomous systems.

  • Performance Optimization – Optimize agent execution for cost, latency, and quality while maintaining the reliability standards required for educational environments.

What We're Looking For

  • Deep Systems Experience – 7+ years building large-scale distributed systems with at least 2+ years in staff/senior roles. Experience with agent orchestration, workflow engines, or autonomous system infrastructure.

  • Agent & AI Systems – Hands-on experience building agent applications with tool calling, context engineering, multi-step reasoning, or autonomous workflow orchestration. Familiarity with LLM integration patterns.

  • Technical Stack – Strong coding skills in Python, TypeScript/Node.js, or Go. Experience with our stack (TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, NextJS, Supabase) or similar technologies.

  • Infrastructure & Security – Working knowledge of containers, virtualization, sandboxing, and security patterns for multi-tenant systems. Experience with metrics, observability, and incident response.

  • Educational Context Awareness – Understanding of or interest in educational workflows, privacy requirements (FERPA/COPPA), and safety considerations for AI in classroom environments.

  • Leadership & Impact – Track record of architecting complex systems, mentoring engineers, and driving technical decisions that balance innovation with reliability.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with educational technology integrations, LMS systems, or EdTech compliance requirements

  • Background in ML/AI infrastructure, model serving, or AI safety systems

  • Experience with open protocols for tool connectivity (MCP-style connectors) or browser automation

  • Security hardening experience for untrusted code execution or multi-tenant educational environments

  • Technical Leadership – Lead the architecture and implementation of MagicSchool's core agent infrastructure, making high-leverage decisions that enable reliable autonomous AI in education.

  • End-to-End Ownership – Own agent systems from research prototype to production deployment, ensuring they meet the reliability and safety standards required for educational use.

Join a top team at a fast growing company that is working towards real social impact. Make an account and try us out at our website https://www.magicschool.ai and connect with our passionate community on our Wall of Love https://love.magicschool.ai/all.


SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER – AI EXPERIENCES

Role Description
As a Senior Product Manager focused on new AI applications, you will lead the exploration, development and launch of an entirely new product line at MagicSchool. This is a highly entrepreneurial role where you will be responsible for both evaluating opportunities for new AI-powered products, and working cross functionally to build them. This is a “zero to one” role, perfect for a product manager who is comfortable with ambiguity, and is pragmatic in their approach to translate opportunities into high-impact products for educators and students.

Responsibilities
In this role, you will be responsible for driving towards the following outcomes:

 - Evaluate, define and execute the product vision for a new AI-powered product in education.

 - Operate in a highly ambiguous environment, driving 0→1 innovation by rapidly testing, validating, and scaling new ideas.

 - Represent the voice of educators and students, balancing user needs with business goals in new AI-driven product lines.

 - Partner cross-functionally with engineering, design, marketing, and other stakeholders to bring new initiatives to life.

 - Build strong business cases for investment in AI initiatives, using data and research to prioritize effectively.
   

Experience & Qualifications
To be successful in this role, you’ll bring the following experience and qualifications:

 - 5+ years of product management experience, with a proven track record in building and scaling 0→1 products with demonstrable user impact.

 - Deep understanding of AI technologies and applications, ideally with direct experience building consumer-facing AI products such as chatbots, agents, workflows, multimodal, multimedia, etc.

 - Comfort navigating ambiguity, with founder/early builder experience strongly preferred.

 - Strong cross-functional collaboration skills; able to communicate persuasively with engineering, design, marketing, legal, and finance.

 - Proficiency in using data (qualitative and quantitative) to inform product decisions and measure success.

 - Excellent execution skills: ability to balance long-term vision with fast iteration in a high-growth environment.

 - Nice to have:
   
   - Passion for education and prior EdTech experience
   
   - Strong experience building and launching AI-powered applications and features
   
   - B2C and SaaS experience

Notice: Priority Deadline and Review Start Date

Please note that applications for this position will be accepted until 10/26/25 - applications received after this date will be reviewed on an intermittent basis.  - Join a mission-driven team passionate about making education more efficient and equitable.

 - Flexibility of working from home, while fostering a unique culture built on relationships, trust, communication, and collaboration with our team - no matter where they live.

 - Unlimited time off to empower our employees to manage their work-life balance. We work hard for our teachers and users, and encourage our employees to rest and take the time they need.

 - Choice of employer-paid health insurance plans so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Dental and vision are also offered at very low premiums.

 - Every employee is offered generous stock options, vested over 4 years.

 - Plus a 401k match & monthly wellness stipend

Our Values:

 - Joy and Magic: Bring joy and magic into every learning experience - push the boundaries of what’s possible with AI.

Join a top team at a fast growing company that is working towards real social impact. Make an account and try us out at our website and connect with our passionate community on our Wall of Love.

Responsibilities

  • Understand user behavior
    Map key journeys (onboarding → activation → habitual use). Quantify drop-offs and identify behaviors linked to long-term engagement using funnels, cohorts, and retention analyses.

  • Drive product growth
    Quantify and forecast the impact of product changes on activation, engagement, and retention using funnels/cohorts; provide evidence and confidence ranges to inform prioritization.

  • Measure impact of changes
    Help design and analyze A/B tests with product and engineering; define primary and guardrail metrics; share results and next steps in plain language.

  • Make analytics usable across teams
    Publish decision-ready dashboards and short write-ups that answer: what changed, why, what to do next. Keep metric definitions consistent and documented; contribute to model development so trusted data is easy to reuse.

  • Support customer-facing reporting
    Help define and maintain usage metrics for school/district admins (embedded or in-product), with reliability checks and clear definitions.

  • Run clean intake for ad-hoc requests
